column1: starts off with a wonderful yorker first up and goes up in loud appeal. Shake of the head by the umpire and Jason Holder has gone up for a review. Ultra-Edge confirms no bat.Pitches on middle, swings in late, and it's taking out leg stump. What a start for West Indies! Wicket off the first ball, and it's Martin Guptill, the man who hit 237 against them in the 2015 World Cup quarterfinal

full toss second ball outside off, stroked easily through cover, and a bit of comical fielding by Brathwaite. He was running after the ball and dived too early with the ball still away from him! Ends up sprawled on the ground with the ball running away from him, until Shai Hope scrambles and picks it up. To no avail - they have run four!
fuller on off, patted back

overpitched outside off, and a trademark Kane Williamson cover drive, all touch and elegance. No comical misfields that time, and Brathwaite got a hand to it diving to his left inside the circle to slow it up

take a bow Sheldon Cottrell. take a salute. Inswinging yorker, late swing again and Colin Munro has no clue about it as it shatters his stumps. He's got both openers for golden ducks in his opening over.
too full on the pads, and tucked away nicely by Taylor through midwicket. Big chase put in and they get three. What a first over.
jags back in sharply off a length and hits Taylor on the back thigh pad
given width outside off and flayed through point, magnificently timed square drive. He's in form, it shows.
fuller length on off, he gets behind it solidly and defends
chipped in the air but short of cover. Fuller outside off, he went for the drive but mis-timed it. Didn't carry to the fielder though
fuller on the stumps, clipped to mid-on
he's sticking to the new strategy of bowling full. This one is yorker length outside off, Kane tries to slide it down to third man, but misses
ooh that's a beauty. changes his length up, pitching it on the hard length and getting it to jag across him. Squares up Kane and whistles past his outside edge
and another one pitched fuller, Kane has a go at the drive, but the angle takes it past his outside edge again. 'Have another catcher, please' says Ian Bishop on air.
full outside off again, but this time he's able to get to the pitch of the ball and drive to mid-off
another one jagging across Williamson, pitched on back of a length, has him feeling for it. Misses the outside edge again. Maiden
length ball on the pads, tucked to fine leg
good length but well outside off, Kane shoulders arms
outside edge goes past Gayle at slip and runs away to the boundary. Played with an angled bat, but the angle still results in an edge. Gayle puts in a dive but it brushes past his finger tips
length ball outside off, glided to third man
good length outside off, steered to point's left
angling into him from slightly wide of the stumps, fuller ball, defended solidly
fuller outside off, driven to cover off the front foot
risky single. length ball into him, tucks it towards square leg. Short midwicket runs around and gets there, throws the stumps down, but Taylor is home
good length, on the off-stump line, and getting some carry. He gets behind it and defends
getting some shape away again, pitches on a length and moves, this time Williamson is not drawn into the drive, but lets it go
length ball on the stumps, defended with a straight bat
keeps it on a tight leash, with an off stump line and the safest option is to defend, which Kane does
fuller, swinging in a touch, jabbed towards mid-on
oooh, that's gone past the outside edge. He was playing inside the line, bowled from slightly wide of the crease and coming in
good length on off stump, patted back
bounces to Gayle at slip. Good length from wide of the crease and straightens, Taylor was looking to play it across, takes the edge. But bounces in front of Gayle
pushed to cover
he's taking a few steps down the pitch, perhaps to throw the bowler off his length. Pats this slightly fuller ball to mid-on
good length angling across, tries to cut it but chops it down near his feet
back of a length on leg stump, tucked off his hip towards square leg
back of a length on leg stump again, and he tucks it to square leg
goes length this time and on off stump, defended into the offside
digs it in short - the first short ball perhaps of this innings and it's almost 7 overs in. Outside off and he arches out of the way
overpitched outside off, and a confident front-foot cover drive unfurled. The men in the circle cut it off though
ooh that's hit him on the glove. Back of a length climbing into him, and Williamson ducked, taking his eyes off the ball. But it's not a bouncer and pings into the left glove. Painful undoubtedly
length ball, patted towards mid-on
fuller on the stumps, pushed to mid-on
length ball outside off, gets across and punches into the on-side
back of a length outside off, cuts it nicely but can't go past point
back of a length outside off, punched confidently but short cover is in place and fields
fuller length outside off, driven to mid-off
too full on off, worked across to the onside, but Brathwaite dives to his right at mid-on to stop the ball
angling into him on a length, flicked off his pads to square leg
angling into him again, worked across but straight to short midwicket
good length, nipping in from outside off, patted into the legside
fuller, straying on the pads again, and if clipped to deep square leg
fuller outside off, patted towards the bowler's left
good length, sticking to the angle into the right-hander, blocked with a straight bat
gets it too straight that time, which allows Taylor to tuck it off his pads to deep square leg
fuller length on off, driven to mid-off
length ball outside off, patted to cover
good length outside off, pushed to the bowler's left
good length, coming into him, clipped to square leg
length ball on the stumps, moves across and tucks it to fine leg. He's over-stepped too, so it'll be a free hit
bowls a nice short ball outside off, at good pace and Taylor swishes a pull and misses
another short ball, Taylor ducks under it
good length outside off, patted back to the bowler
length ball coming in a touch, clipped to short midwicket
fuller outside off, mis-times his drive to cover
fancy footwork at the fine leg boundary by Cottrell saves a boundary. Short ball on off, but cleverly played, he moves across and tapped it down very fine
fuller on off, defended back to the bowler
driven down the ground past mid-on, Oshane runs back from mid-on to field
fuller on the stumps, flicked to midwicket
good length outside off, steered to point
good length, patted to midwicket
signs of aggression, comes on the front foot to this one outside off to flick it in the air to deep square
short ball outside off, he stays beside the ball and goes up on his toes to guide it to third man
fuller on the pads, tucked away but straight to midwicket
wham. A few steps down and Taylor pulls this across the line disdainfully to the deep midwicket boundary. You felt that shot was coming, with Taylor growing a bit impatient
nicely timed straight drive, more of a push, very straight, but mid-on dives and saves
starts off with one very full one outside off, driven fluently - but once again straight to the fielder.
length ball on off, come son the front foot and uses his wrists to flick it to deep square
good length outside off, steered to point
smashing cut. Given room outside off, and too short, Kane twirls his bat in a pleasing arc to send this to the point boundary
good length on off, gets his bat down in time to jab it to mid-on
driven uppishly, but bounces well in front of mid-off. Full ball outside off
short ball outside off, doesn't rise enough and Taylor absolutely lays into that pull shot, sending the ball screaming to the midwicket boundary
goes fuller now and on the stumps, patted back to the bowler
good length, nipping in on middle, clipped off his pads to mid-on
length ball on the pads, easily tucked to deep square
fuller on off, walks into the drive but plays it with soft hands to mid-off, so they can get the single comfortably
length ball coming into him, patted down close to him on the legside for another single
full toss on middle stump, punched off the inside half, on the bounce to mid-on
length at off stump, blocked solidly on the front foot
length and just outside off, jabbed on the rise to cover
length and staying low on a middle stump line. Shuffles and flicks to deep square's left
short of a length outside off and a handsome punch off the back foot. Finds cover though
length and just outside off, allows it to come on and opens the face to deflect to third man
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square with the angle
length and slanted in at leg stump. Plants the front leg across and flicks to deep midwicket's left
shot! Oh he's properly in now. Full ball outside off. Nicely behind the line, holds his shape, and drives with a half stride to beat mid-off to the left
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
short at off stump, swats it off the toe-end to deep midwicket
length on middle stump, leans in and check-drives past the non-striker. Not timed to perfection but enough on this to beat the chasing mid-on
short of a length on leg stump, dabbed to midwicket's right off the back foot
length on leg stump, flicked down to fine leg
length at off stump, taps to...well, extra midwicket. A fielder between midwicket and mid-on. He takes off for the run. It's his call. Williamson sends him back and he is visibly annoyed by it
short of a length outside off, chopped to point
length on off stump, dropped to cover's left with soft hands
length at leg stump, flicked into the midwicket region and once again, some hesitation as they run
length on leg stump, nudged to midwicket on the front foot
gets in an awful position as he half plays, half leaves this short ball at his chest. Ball slams the bat and ends up at point
length on middle stump, defended towards mid-on
slower short ball at leg stump, pulled straight to deep square
short of a length in the corridor, gets on top of the bounce and slices to third man
short of a length outside off, steered to backward point
short of a length just outside off, can't beat backward point again for the single at third man
short of a length in the corridor, manages to run it down to third man off the back foot this time
short of a length in the corridor, defended into the off side
short and wide outside off, slapped straight to extra cover
short and wide outside off, sits up waist height and he slaps it to extra cover's right
full on middle stump, flicked to mid-on
makes room and punches it through the off side. Short of a length and angled into his body, but he skips into the leg side to make room and finds the point boundary
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length on leg stump, glanced to fine leg
slower short ball at middle stump, pulled to deep square
short and down leg side. Pulled with the angle down to fine leg
length on middle stump, whipped to mid-on off the back foot
length on off stump, defended into the off side
length on off stump, punched back at the bowler off the back foot
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length on middle stump, defended down the pitch
length on leg stump, allows it to run onto him and tickles it to fine leg
length ball, gentle turn in from outside off, goes back to punch this to mid-on
nicely looped up outside off, very full, driven to the man on the cover boundary
oooh, that's an outside edge, but falls short of short third man. Had a big flay at it, well wide of off
allows it to come on to him this time and steers to short third man
goes back to punch to long-on
flayed through cover powerfully, but there is protection in the deep
comes forward to this length ball outside off, doesn't quite get to the pitch and it hangs in the air for a tiny fraction longer than ideal, but no real danger of it popping up for a fielder
goes wider of the crease and angles it in, clipped off his pads, but to midwicket
fuller length outside off, big stride out and defends to mid-off
too full, driven from the crease, but not timed well enough and mid-on and run around, tumble and save it.
nondescript ball on leg, turned away to square leg and just like that, Kane Williamson has another ODI fifty
drilled straight back and Taylor also gets to fifty. Very full on leg stump, short-arm push travels fast.
full on middle stump, driven to long-on off the front foot
length on off stump, shoveled towards long-on off the front foot. Nurse gets a hand on it but can't stop the run that brings up the 100 stand
tossed up full and wide outside off, driven to sweeper cover
full, flat, outside off. Driven to sweeper cover
length outside off, opens the face and runs it to short third's left
length on leg stump, looks to flick and is beaten. It deflects off Hope and runs past short fine
short of a length on leg stump, flicked to fine leg
offcutter at a length on leg stump. Flicked to fine leg
short ball slanted across the corridor, ducks out of the way to let it go
slower short ball wide outside off, cared to third man's right. Brathwaite with a dive to his right to keep that to two
length on leg stump, flicked to mid-on off the front foot
full on middle stump, jammed into the pitch with the drive. Cottrell reaches up one-handed to field this
length at off stump, gets forward and pokes it back down the pitch
short of a length just outside off, backs away to cut and is beaten
length at middle, pushed to the bowler
short of a length on leg stump, expertly clipped to deep square's left off the back foot
length on middle, flicked to long-on off the front foot
short of a length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
short of a length just outside off, cut to third man's right
wow. What a time to be alive. Overpitched on middle stump and he offers the full face, using the angle into him to get it between stumps and Taylor. Steady head, high elbow. Gorgeous
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
full on middle stump, drills this back towards the bowler who gets a hand on it
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover off the front foot
full on off stump, leans in and chips this over the bowler. Long-on cleans up to his left
full on leg stump, driven to long-on
length on leg stump, flicked to short fine
full outside off, makes some room to place this drive to sweeper's right
length on middle stump, tapped to midwicket off the back foot
length at middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
wide of mid-off and into the boundary. Length outside off, extends his arms and check-punches on the rise. Looked like that stopped on him, but safe enough in the end
length in the corridor, runs it down to third man off the front foot
overpitched outside off, square drive finds point who fumbles
length on middle stump, flicked to deep square's left
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square's left. Once again, via a Cottrell misfield at midwicket
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket's right
length at leg stump, flicked to deep square
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right off the back foot
full on off stump, opens the face and pushes to point's right
full and wide outside off, looks to slice through backward point, can't beat Cottrell's dive to the right
full on middle, driven to long-on
length just outside off, opens the face, runs it to third man
length on leg stump, can't get bat on the attempted flick. Cops it on the pad
length on middle stump, pushed to mid-on off the back foot
short of a length on leg stump, looks to pull, gets it off the under-edge to deep square
short outside off, mistimed pull to midwicket
length on off stump, defended into the leg side
starts off with one that is a bit too short, and the batsman moves back to flick to deep square
good length but drifting on the pads, flicked to square leg
given some air, but drifts on leg, and picked off his pads. Can't beat short fine leg though, so only a single
length ball on off, gentle turn, he comes forward and pushes this to the on-side. Mid-on tumbles but mis-fields
drifting again, picked off to short fine leg
tossed up and dipping nicely on him, clipped to mid-on
length ball on the stumps, tries to pull it but goes over the ball, it rolls off his thigh pad
was standing well outside leg stump, but Brathwaite followed him, called his bluff. Taylor unable to get room to free his arms, and doesn't connect, rolls off his pads
standing way outside leg again, and he follows him again. Taylor can only nurdle it to short fine leg
magic shot! looked like a gentle punch, no real force on it, but it travels all the way to the cover fence. Just like that, Kane Williamson is past 90
flicked off the pads to deep square leg
fuller on off, flick-driven to long-on
fires it down legside that time for a wide
fuller on off, driven to extra cover
down the track but cleverly done by Gayle, fires it in and converts it to a yorker, which Taylor can only clip to mid-on

Gayle's got a wicket! New Zealand wanted to up the rate, Taylor has been getting bogged down in the past few overs, comes down the track to try and loft it over long-off, but can't middle it and Jason Holder at mid-off holds the catch above his head. Gayle punches the air in delight and then comically holds his shoulder and winces in pain. Entertainment unlimited
patted to long-on
ooh near miss backing away to cut and doesn't connect, it just goes past off stump!
fuller on the pads, tucked to deep square
fuller outside off, given room, creamed though the offside
back foot punch to sweeper cover
length ball outside off, chopped to point
back of a length outside off, punched to cover's left. Who's at cover? Gayle's at cover.
back of a length, angling across him, pats it down towards cover
back of a length, flirting with that off stump line again, patted down
fuller on off, defended
length ball nipping in from off, tucked to deep square leg
nicely driven through cover, too full and in the slot angling away from him, punchy drive
stays on 99. Clips this short of a lenth ball towards short midwicket, thinks of a run, is loudly sent back by Latham. There was no run there
length ball coming into him, tucked to square leg, straight to the fielder
good bowling, bouncer outside off to finish, and Kane lets it go. He'll have to spend some more time on 99
length ball nipping across him, pushes it past the bowler and they take a quick single
in the slot to drive and he strokes it fairly well, but Nurse at short cover dives to his left and stops the ball

and he's got there. With a boundary, pulled to fine leg. First century against West Indies. Back to back hundreds in the World Cup. Whaddaplayya! Was a filthy ball, short and down legside, and Williamson said thank you very much
length ball outside off, steered to point
on the pads, flicked to deep square leg
back of a length on leg stump, flicked off his pads to fine leg
length ball on off, goes back and punches to long on
flatter outside off, well bowled, not much room to cut. Ends up steering towards point
flatter and shorter, waits for it and punches past cover
down the track, and picks it up off his pads to flick to deep midwicket
tossed up, ends up as a full toss but he mis-times the drive straight back to the bowler
strays down leg and is clipped to deep square leg
super shot. moves inside the line, and pulls this to fine leg. Saw that fine leg was up, and moved into position to hoick it over the man. Holder's shorter length made it easier
lovely, so lovely. Holder sent fine leg back and bowled fuller, but Williamson just unfurls one of those dreamy cover drives of his, placing the ball like a surgeon between extra cover and mid-off
length ball outside off, squirted to third man off a thick outside edge
back of a length on leg stump, moves inside the line to flick it off his pads to fine leg
back of a length outside off, bounces a tad lower than expected perhaps, and he punches to cover's left
short ball on leg stump, paddled down to fine leg
goes for the reverse sweep, but doesn't connect. length bal loutside off
fuller on the stumps, clipped to long-on
filthy ball but Kane can't capitalise. Very short and down leg, tried to swipe it too hard perhaps, and just got some glove on it, bounced down and to the keeper
better one, fuller, almost yorker length, guided towards point with a horizontal bat
down the track and goes inside out, but doesn't really time it. Bounces down to sweeper cover
outside edge goes for four. Too close to cut, decent ball actually. Williamson went hard at it, got a top edge from high on the bat and it goes fine where no fielder is there
drags it down short, swats it away but not timed well and it trickles to deep square leg
lovely shot, but there is protection in the deep. Gave himself room, got on top of the bounce and square drove it
full on the pads, flicked to deep square leg
low full toss outside off, he gets down low and drives powerfully but mid-off fields to his left

top edge gobbled by Cottrell. Out comes the march and salute. Not short enough to pull, but Latham is under pressure to go big and swipes across the line. Gets a top edge that loops straight back to the bowler. Third wicket for Cottrell
good length on the stumps, patted back to the bowler
fires it in to him, cramps him for room, pushed back to the bowler
fuller length, comes on the front foot to clip to mid-on
fuller, driven to long-on
and he just keeps pulling these shots out. Waits in his crease, goes deep and cuts this ball to the point boundary. Easy as you like it
fuller around off, comes forward and clips it to long-on
drifts on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
short outside off, has a slash at it but doesn't time it, trickles off the toe end to cover
Neesham could be run out here Direct hit from mid-off, he was a bit lazy to take off after tapping it there, but he's made it in the end.

through him and West Indies are considering a review for caught behind. No wait, they are not. The umpires are going upstairs I think. Yes they are. Soft signal is out. Lovely ball, on leg stump and cutting in. Williamson was moving away, giving himself room, gets cramped and the ball goes between his bat and body, takes a feather. Hope dives to his left to take the ball. But replays show he grounded it while diving. Kane survives
and he celebrates by crashing this length ball square. Gave himself room, had the length and width to play that shot, sent it screaming to the fence
moves inside the line to pull but doesn't connect. Ball goes over leg stump, or very close to it, so not a wide
slower ball picked up for six. Tried for a leg stump yorker, floating it up, Williamson read it, moved across and slog swept it over deep square leg. He's moving rapidly now
length ball on leg stump, Neesham does the right thing in working it round the corner and turning the strike over to Williamson
flatter, stump to stump, flat batted to long-on
fuller on leg, picked off his toes to long-on
tossed up, ends up as a low full toss, uses his wrists to flick this to deep midwicket and pick up a couple
slog swept do deep midwicket to equal his highest ODI score of 145. In the slot, full enough to pull that off, and he nails it
fuller outside off and he gets to his highest ODI score with a wristy drive to long-off
overpitched outside off, driven forcefully, but Cottrell at mid-off dives to his left and pulls off another brilliant bit of fielding
well bowled. Saw Kane giving himself room, a bit too much, and kept it wide of off. Kane couldn't reach the ball
slower ball, on a length outside off, he waits for it and flashes it through cover. Had to manufacture the pace himself

brilliant effort by Hetmyer on the deep square leg boundary. But unfortunately, it's still a six. Half volley on the pads, and Neesham picked that up beautifully. Seemed headed for six, but Hetmyer came leaping while running to his left and tried to push the ball back into play. Unfortunately touched the boundary triangle too
full outside off and absolutely leathered through extra cover, bu there is protection in the deep
slower bouncer, Neesham waits for it and pulls it to deep square
that's a stunning looking straight drive back over the bowler's head, but long-on is very straight so they get only a single
moves across and wanted to send this ball downtown but connects only with air. That went fairly close to off stump too

caught by Hope running back. Fourth wicket for Cottrell and Williamson's magnificent innings is over. Went across to try and heave it over deep square leg, but got a top edge that went really really high, swirling over Hope's head. He did well to run back and settle under it.
back of a length, pulls to deep midwicket
length ball outside off, nicely steered to third man
nicely bowled, short ball outside off, gets good carry and Neesham is left feeling for the ball, doesn't connect
clobbered to deep extra cover. In the slot, full outside off and CdG is in form, so goes after it. There is a man back there though
wanted to go for the wide yorker, but it's too wide, outside the tramlines
manages to get this full and wide, but CdG was even better! Carves this over deep backward point - to his left in fact and into the vacant third man fence
slower ball, length outside off, still keeping it well wide of off, he waits for it and cuts
goes for the yorker on the fifth stump that time, and catches the batsman by surprise. He adjusts and gets his bat along the ground to steer to short third man
pulled with power, but there is a man at deep square. This was dug into the pitch outside off

bursts through Hetmyer's hands at deep cover That was hit with some power. Would have been amazing if he had caught it. Wide outside off again and he literally threw the kitchen sink at it, leathering it over cover. Hetmyer leaps up at the boundary and gets hands to it, but those either just stick or don't. This one didn't

Sheldon Cottrell you legend! he's run CdG out at the non-striker's end. Length ball on the pads, Neesham tried to work it away but couldn't connect. Took a few steps down, CdG was more than halfway down by then. Cottrell ran forward, picked up the ball and threw down the stumps. It'll go as a run-out, but he's got a fifer in my book
short ball outside off, Neesham fetches the pull from there and gets it in the gap at deep midwicket for a couple
back of a length and into his body, he can only nudge it to third man from the crease
digs this in short but its going down leg. Santner was moving across so Cottrell thinks that's a harsh call, but I suspect it would have just about been wide anyway
yorker length on the stumps, digs this out to long-on
full toss and Neesham heaves across the line to deep square leg. Didn't time it well so there is enough time for deep midwicket to sprint and cut of the boundary
clobbered. Short ball outside off, he fetches the pull and nails it in the gap at deep midwicket
well bowled, yorker on off stump, clipped to long-on while almost falling over
keeps it wide of off stump and he mis-times his drive to mid-off
length ball on off that time and he's swung across the line to deep square leg
nailed. slog-sweeping slot, and he lifts this over deep square leg

length ball wide outside off, Santner tries to go over long-off, but he's taken the pace off, so it swirls off the toe-end. Cottrell - who else - is at mid-off, and he runs back to take a good tumbling catch. Can't keep him out of the action
and the innings ends with another catch for Cottrell. Another slower ball, wide of off stump, Neesham throws his bat at it, doesn't get hold of it. Simple catch for Cottrell at mid-off.
full outswinger on off stump, poked back to the bowler
short ball. Gayle drops the bat and cops this on the shoulder. Deflects through to the keeper
full outswinger from leg stump. Nearly squares him up but he manages to get this to mid-on
length and swung away outside off. Hangs the bat inside the line and lets it go
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
short of a length on off, defended solidly on the back foot
short of a length just outside off, gets behind the line and opens the face for a single at third man
length ball pushed across off stump. Left alone
full and very wide outside off. Left alone
full and wide outside off, left alone
short and wide outside off, pushes away from the body, drops it into the off side
length outside off, hangs the bat out and gets a thick edge down to third man
length on middle stump, defended to point off the outside half
length and angled in at middle stump, drops it in front of mid-on with soft hands
short and wide outside off, looks to cut, under-edges into the point region

dragged it on! Boult pushes one across, very wide outside off. Hope throws his hands at it for the drive. It's not a menacing ball - going straight across - but it's a tad far. And there's no real way he can be close to it for the drive. Inside edge and into the stumps
length on off stump, defended into the off side
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket with a stride across
bouncer at a leg stump line. Ducks and lets it go
length in the corridor, defended into the point region
length on leg stump, stays rooted to the crease and tickles this fine
short and climbing across the corridor, left alone
short and wide outside off, slapped firmly, but straight to cover
length and just outside off. Stabbed past the non-striker
full on leg stump, watchfully turned to fine leg's right off the toe-end
length on middle stump, solidly defended on the back foot
short and wide outside off, slashes and gets a thick edge down to third man
short of a length outswinger, lazily pokes at it, beaten
length and curving away in the corridor. Pushes with hard hands, thick edge to third man
length and swung away from off stump. Closes the face and taps this to mid-on
bouncer at middle stump, ducks and to let it go
short at the ribs, gets on top of it and whips this to the long leg boundary. Closed his eyes on it, but perfect connection
pumped over wide long-on! Full and just outside off. Hangs on the back foot and merely lifts the bat from underneath it. Goes a long way for what looks a chip at best
stunning take from Latham. Length ball pushed across off stump, swings and misses. This keeps moving away, towards first slip. Latham dives one-handed to hold it
short and just outside off, mistimed pull to mid-on
slower short ball climbing up at middle stump. Looks to pull and cops this on his body. Was through that before it arrived
short of a length at off stump. Looks to cut. Under-edges into the off side
length on leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket

taken by Latham! Superb bouncer from Boult catches Pooran completely out of position for the pull. It's short and rising steeply in the corridor. He leaps and looks to hook. The top-edge is right above the keeper
length at middle stump, tapped to midwicket
sweet! Full on middle stump and he leans in at this without letting his head fall over. And then, wonderful wrists to flick this past midwicket. Sprints to the boundary
length on leg stump, flicked to fine leg's right
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot

dropped by Boult, who generally holds onto impossible catches! What an effort. Short ball cramps him on the full. He ends up slicing it. Boult runs backward from short fine and dives backwards as well. But can only parry it into the boundary
no catching this. Short again but more room this time. Outside off. Spanked over long-on
top edge over the long leg boundary! Short again, cramped again, no control again on the pull. But it's runs yet again. Henry has paid twice now for bowling short without fine leg back
short at off stump, under-edged pull to midwicket
bouncer, very short and wide outside off. Left alone
short of a length at off stump, opens the face and drops it in front of short third
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
a work of genius. A near-Natmeg inadvertently from Gayle. Boult nails the yorker at leg stump and Gayle jams down at it with his back leg raise. Inside edge runs fine
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
full outside off, tapped to extra cover off the front foot
short of a length at off stump, opens the face to run this to backward point's right
length in the corridor, defended into the gully region
length outside off, driven on the up to mid-off's right
length on middle stump, punched on the up to the bowler
length on off stump, defended to point off the back foot
full on middle stump, driven past the non-striker
short at off stump, nicely behind the line and swiped with vigour to the midwicket boundary
miscued pull but safely over mid-on. Short at off, stuck on the front foot as he looks to pull and it hits the high part of the bat and clears the fielder
full on leg stump, allows it to come on and closes the face late to get this past short fine
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
beats deep square. Short of a length in the corridor, stays leg side of this and pulls cleanly to that fielder's right
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length on off, defended off the back foot
beats the fielder again! Short of a length and he climbs into it. This time a touch under the ball and on the front foot, but a clean swing nonetheless to find the midwicket boundary
superb. What a talent this guy. Length outside off and he gets his weight on the front foot to slap through the line and beat deep cover's dive to the left
beats the edge. Short and slanted across off stump. Looks to poke at it. Ball fizzes by before he knows it
length on middle stump, dropped in front of extra cover with soft hands
short and at the helmet. Barely stays on his feet as he hooks this down to fine leg
yorker down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
short of a length on leg stump, nudged into the leg side
short of a length on off stump, defended to point
length and wide outside off. Swipes under it and is beaten
full and wide outside off, left alone
short outside off, sliced to third man
lovely stop by Guptill. Short and just outside off, cut hard but the right hand sticks out and stops this
length on off stump, pushed through cover off the back foot
length outside off, pokes to extra cover's left on the up
short and wide outside off, looks to spank it on the up. Too much bounce. Ends up at mid-on off the inside edge
mean bouncer, but sufficiently leg side of Gayle for him to let it go
short and climbing across the corridor at 146kph. Drops the bat to let it go
length on leg stump, flicked to square leg off the inside half
short at middle stump, dropped into the covers with soft hands
flat-bats a short ball over his partner! Incredible. This is at chest height outside off and he's managed to get it to the straight boundary. What hands. To the fastest bowler today, no less.
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
short of a outside off, left alone
short and just outside off, pulled uppishly out to deep midwicket
short in the corridor, left alone
short of a length and nipping back in towards off stump. Beats the inside edge as he shapes to cut
clears point. Short and wide at 131kph. Neesham offers everything he possibly could, and Gayle accepts. A neat little slice over point to bring up his fifty
short and wide outside off, left alone
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length at middle stump, defended on the front foot
yorker at middle stump, tapped back to the bowler
length on off stump, opens the face and runs to backward point with the angle
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length on leg stump. flicked to deep square
back of a length and very straight, defended from the crease, almost casually
smack. This guy is seriously talented. Too short, and he stays still, transfers weight back and pulls it mightily to deep midwicket
and another! Too short again and he pulls this from in front of his face to deep square leg. Just to show he can hit boundaries in front of, and behind, square
corrects the length to go fuller, and is pushed with soft hands to mid-off for a quick single
length ball angling across, Gayle is like a statue, watching it go past
back of a length angling across again, Gayle lazily cuts it to the man on the sweeper cover boundary
quicker on on the stumps, patted back with a horizontal bat
in his arc, and out of the park! Well not quite out of the park, but clears the boundary at deep midwicket. Fuller on the stumps and he swings it high and mighty
oh what you have done Matt Henry! dropped a sitter at deep square leg. Filthy ball, full toss on leg stump, Gayle swung it without a care in the world. Henry was right there. Ball pops in and out
length ball, pushed to mid-off
fuller outside off, defended

two dropped chances in the same over! what is happening? Gayle is unconcerned about the previous drop, swings for the fences again off a fuller ball on the stumps. Goes midwicket direction, and Munro is running in, gets both hands to it at chest height, but somehow can't hold on and the ball trickles over the fence. Tough chance, but he had got there
length ball outside off, pushed into the offside
another length ball, punched back firmly
lovely shot, extension of the arms to a fullish one outside off to cream this through cover. There is protection in the deep
fuller and well outside off, driven to cover
length ball on leg stump, patted to the bowler's left
fuller on the stumps, driven to midwicket off the inside half of the bat, getting behind the ball
drags it short and Hetmyer pulls powerfully this time, but along the ground and deep square leg collects
hey injury? take some insult Been dropped twice off the bowler in the previous over, this time, he waits for a bit, and goes straight. In his arc and smashes a huge six
fetch that. Shorter and Gayle rocks back, shows his awesome hitting power by smashing this pull straight over long-on
worked to square leg
fuller on the stumps, driven gently along the ground to long-on

top edge lands in no-man's land. Santner has his hands on his knees and head down. He's got to buy the opposite of a lottery ticket today. Hetmyer went to slog sweep this and got the top edge. It lands perfectly between the circle and the men on the deep
great ball to start, yorker on leg stump, Hetmyer somehow keeps it out, almost falling over
oh this is just superb hitting. Short ball, he rocks back and just swings - not pulls, swings - across the line to smite this over square leg. Raises fifty
another leg stump yorker, but he was giving himself room so is able to hoick it along the ground to fine leg. Not quite a Natmeg, but something in between

slower ball fools him. Pitched it back of a length and Gayle thought it was going down leg, so was letting it go, but by the time he was bringing his bat down is when the ball reached him and hits his bat to drop down on the ground
fuller on the stumps, pushed towards mid-off, and they take a quick single
was clearing his front leg, but Lockie bowled a yorker on the fifth stump. Hetmyer's so well balanced though that he has little trouble adjusting and steering to short third man
length ball angling into him from around the wicket to deny room, punched back
good length outside off, strokes it to cover's right
another length ball outside off, this time Gayle stays on the back foot and opens the face to steer it to point's right

fuller that time outside off, a mite slower, Gayle goes to drive, but gets a bottom edge into the offside. That also seems to have broken off a chunk of wood at the bottom of Gayle's bat, so he'll be changing it
new bat, same result. A bit too short by CdG, and sticks to the outside off line which gives Gayle room to cut powerfully through point
better length, not as short and closer to offstump, steered to third man

he's castled him. Back of a length but it kept low. Hetmyer was going to smash this into oblivion, but the ball sneaks in under his bat and knocks off the bails. Lockie is pumped. He had bowled this at 128k too, so that might have had something to do with it

got him first ball and Lockie is breathing fire into New Zealand's defence. This was a full-length one outside off, and Holder, whose feet aren't really moving well yet, had a waft at it. Got a feather through to the keeper.
bowls a quick bouncer for his hat-trick ball, but Brathwaite gets behind it and defends from in front of his grille

outside edge goes for four despite deflection. It was 146kph, squared up Brathwaite totally, angling into him and he played inside the line. Got an edge that bounced to slip, who dived and parried it. Despite that, the ball travelled to the boundary behind the keeper
shortish, goes deep in his crease and defends to midwicket
short outside off, but dealt with better by Brathwaite, who stays beside the ball and steers it to point. 146kph
given room to cut and he does so, but point dives and fields.
fuller on the fourth stump, driven to cover
Gayle reminds us all he's still there. Very full, and he just takes a front foot stride and smacks a lofted drive into the extra cover fence
has a waft at this one too and gets an edge! but it doesn't carry to short third man. This was not as full, CdG has pulled the length back, but Gayle went for the drive anyway
length ball on the pads and paddled to fine leg. ,b>Gayle runs two!

ho ho ho, this is Collapso Time. Gayle probably thought he needed to hit West Indies out of pressure, so went for another six down the ground. Didn't middle it, got it off the toe-end. He's hit mis-timed sixes before, but this is not one of those times. The ball goes high and settles into long-on's hands. West Indies have imploded.
shot! a full toss outside off, but it needed to be put away and Carlos cover drives it handsomely
length ball on the stumps, tucked towards square leg
length ball, bounces a tad higher than expected, takes the shoulder of the bat from his half-cock push to roll to point
lovely. That's a sparkling cover drive. Round the wicket and full outside off, opens the face of the bat while driving
quick one, jabs at it and keeps it down close to him. They're alive to the possibility of a quick single
length ball on the pads, flicked to midwicket
fired in to him, moves back to cut, gets an under-edge that goes to short fine
slightly more tossed up, draws him forward to defend
flatter on off, goes down to sweep. Doesn't get hold of it, the ball rolls to short fine
nice length, pitches and turns away, he comes on the front foot to defend
quicker one, 96kph, and he has to go back and get his bat down in a hurry to chop at it and keep it away from the stumps
good length again, tossed up slower, but he comes on the front foot and defends well. Maiden
length ball on off, tucks it to the legside

caught behind off the short ball another great take by Latham, who's been impressive today behind the stumps. Boult put his back into this, short ball on the leg stump, cramping him for room. Nurse couldn't resist having a go at trying to pull, but gets a glove that flies to Latham's left, who tumbles and holds.
strays well down legside and he'll have to rebowl that
short of a length outside off, goes to cut, gets an under-edge that bounces past the stumps
yorker on the stumps, Lewis digs it out. And then hobbles. Bad signs for him and West Indies
short ball, and Lewis pulls it straight to the man at deep square leg. Can't really fault him. Given his injured hamstring, all he could do was look for boundaries. Tried, and failed
full toss outside off, think that's a yorker gone wrong. Gets behind it and steers to point
flatter outside off, whipped to mid-on
beaten him! perfect ball, loops and draws him forward, dips and lands in front and spins sharply away
tossed up again, but defended
more loop but a bit fuller, so he can come on the front foot and drive to the man on sweeper cover
flatter, but he stays back and jabs it out
shortens his length because he sees Roach is intent on pressing forward, spins across him but he manages to keep it down
that's pinged him on the grille. On target short ball that lifts nastily and he's not quick enough to get his head out of the way or get his bat in the way
follows it with a length ball, Brathwaite is hanging slightly back, defends from the crease
fullish length slower ball, Brathwaite holds his shape nicely enough though he doesn't time the drive well. Mid-on collects
back of a length, in the channel, steered to point from close to his body
fuller on the stumps, driven to mid-off and they take a quick run
short ball rising up to his chest, awkwardly jabbed to deep cover
length ball outside off, he follows it with his hands and pushes to point
given some air, Roach has a wild swipe at it but the ball sneaks under the bat and beside the offstump
fuller on the pads, clipped to long-on
tossed up, fuller on the stumps, takes a stride out to drive it back to the bowler
that spat out of the footmarks. Gives it some revs and lands it on the spot, it takes off and spins past a suprised Brathwaite's shoulder almost
fuller driven to the bowler's left, he slides and stops
length ball outside off, steps away and has a big slash at it. Travels in the air but lands safe, and CdG runs around from third man to slide and stop the ball
back of a length on the stumps, he goes up on his toes to defend it
a bit fuller but not there for the drive. He chose to try and drive it anyway, gets a thick inside edge that rolls to midwicket
sharp bouncer, on target. Forced the batsman to sway out of the way, since it was homing in on his head
fuller on off, driven fluently but straight to mid-off
back of a length on the stumps, stays back and glides it to third man
that's got air miles on it tossed up very full, he takes a big stride out and swings through the line to send this waaaaay over long-on. 96m six
fuller outside off, driven to extra cover
good length on middle and leg spinning away, gets forward to block
he can't resist having a swipe at that and nails it! Goes down on one knee and lifts this from outside off over long-off
fired into him this time, driven from the crease to long-off
back of a length, he stays back and punches firmly straight to keep strike
length on leg stump, nudged to short fine's left off the inside half
length at middle stump, keeps low but he manages to defend into the leg side off the back foot
length on leg stump, deflected into the leg side off the pad as he looks to flick
length on off stump, punched to long-off on the up
length outside off, stylish drive on the up to find extra cover
length on leg stump, defended into the leg side on the front foot

missed run-out chance at the non-strikers. Brathwaite looks to drive past mid-off and is admiring his shot as Williamson picks it up to his left. Roach has run down the pitch in the meantime and is stranded. Needed a direct hit. Didn't get one
length at leg stump, glanced off the hips through square leg
length at off stump, dropped into the covers off the back foot
144 kph bouncer is too much for everyone. Climbs steeply over the very tall batsman, and the keeper has no chance either
short and wide outside off, slashes and misses
short at leg stump, rides the bounce and defends into the leg side
short in the corridor, opens the face and runs it to third man
length on leg stump, stands tall and whips this wide of short fine
length on off stump, tapped past the bowler with the full face offered. Solid
length on off stump, defended from deep in the crease
length and dipping in late at leg stump, poked off the inside half to deep square
length on off stump, punched on the rise to the bowler
four more. Ten off the over. This is a length ball pushed down leg side. Hardly has anything to do. Flicks this fine
length and in at off stump, defended solidly off the back foot
short and just outside off, defends and steals a single at cover
short and up the ribs. Fends it down to fine leg
length outside off, firmly driven on the up to extra cover
short and just outside off, defended to point off the back foot
yorker fired in at off stump, solidly kept out from Roach
slower ball at a length on off stump, defended to point off the front foot
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
length on off stump, defended into the off side
bouncer at a leg stump line. Gets inside the line and ducks to leave
jumps off a length outside off, but he gets the bottom hand off to defend this
length outside off, looks to drive on the up through cover, gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
length on off stump, punched to long-off off the back foot
length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
arm ball at a length on off stump. Defended on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, sliced to short third
short of a length and ripping away from off, thick outside edge to short third
quicker one at a length, cramping him on off stump. Forces him to push back down the pitch

edged! And the bowling change brings the wicket at last for New Zealand. Kemar Roach, so impressive until no, but he chases this one outside off. No feet. It's a thin edge and his resistance ends. This is short of a length and climbing outside off. Too fast for his waft away from the body
length at middle stump, hops and defends to midwicket
length on middle stump, defended to mid-on
full and just outside off. Driven to mid-off
short of a length just outside off, stabbed down to third man
past the keeper and four. A hint of conviction in this four off the outside edge - the face was opened late. Ball straightened in the corridor from a good length
length outside off, pushed to cover with the turn
outside edge safely past slip. This turns big from middle stump as he pushes forward with hard hands
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
length on off, defended on the back foot
heaves it out to deep square's left. Length ball skidding on with the arm, comes off the thick inside edge
full on off stump, driven to long-off
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square leg
length on off stump, defended into the covers
length at off stump, defended to point

collision avoided as Neesham and Santner run for the ball in the covers. Cottrell had just dropped it pitch side and the run out chance was on. In the end, neither got the ball. But more importantly, they've avoided some pain

overthrow as Santner picks up the ball this time and throws at the striker's end. No one backing up for that particular angle so Brathwaite can get the run that brings him his fifty. This is a seriously good knock from him
length outside off, opens the face and gets it down to third man
short and wide outside off, slaps it past short third man with a big swing
length on off stump, gently poked to extra cover's left with soft hands
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
falls short of short third man. Length ball turning away outside off. Cottrell throws his hands at it and gets a leading edge to clear slip
length on leg stump, whipped to long-on and Cottrell sprints back for the second! Lovely running and game awareness

Cottrell sends him back and it is the right call. Brathwaite was ready to run after defending this into the off side. But it was a quicker one and it pinged quickly towards point. It was trouble if they'd gone
full and just outside off, poked to extra cover off the toe-end
bouncer in the corridor, awkwardly ducks, but sufficiently out of the way
short of a length on leg stump, gets inside the line and has a whip at it. And connects! This races to the fine leg boundary
and now the third man boundary! Short of a length outside off, falls over towards the ball and stabs at it. Gets an outside edge past the keeper
leaps off the ground and defends this bouncer. Well done, Cottrell! Gets the bottom hand off and drops it down
length outside off, defended to point off the back foot
length ball on the pads, flicked to square leg and he's got enough confidence now in Cottrell to take a single
another nasty bouncer, but Cottrell goes up on his toes and keeps it down again, takes his hand off the bat too
hanging back, Boult bowls the fuller length ball on off stump, but Cottrell gets behind it and defends
angling across him back of a length Cottrell moves across and defends
fuller on off, comes forward and defends now. Slower ball.
it is, but Cottrell survives. back of a length slanting away, he follows it with his hands but doesn't nick off.
legcutter at a length just outside off, rips past the edge as he pokes at it
length and rising over middle stump as he opens the face to run it down. Beaten
short and in at the body. Inside edge onto body
slower ball at a length outside off, carved out to sweeper on the up
off the pad but won't get past Latham who dives to his left. Length ball on leg stump, shuffles and has a swing at it. Can't get bat
through him! Is that it? Lockie using that pace of his to fire one in full, angling in off the pitch, beating the inside edge and smashing the stumps
pumps it past the stumps! Right, there won't be any more hanging about. Length ball just outside off, clears the front leg and hammers it on the rise. Mid-off is in. No one stopping this
pulled to deep square's left and Oshane has actually though about staying in the crease at the other end! All good in the end as the fielder has to recover and there's time to complete the second

lovely stop from Williamson! Gets big and flaps out his left hand as he slides to stop this on the half-volley mid-off. Brathwaite cleared the front leg and sliced this to his left. The stop means Oshane is on strike.
length on off stump, solidly defended on the front foot
well played. Dipping in at his leg stump is this mean yorker, but he manages to get the bat down on it
that's the end of Boult. Oshane has done it. He's played three balls from the best bowler on the day. What a spell from Boult, but he couldn't get this last inswinger past Oshane's push to mid-on
follows him down leg side with the full ball. Powerfully driven to long-on, no run taken
just misses off stump. Legcutter at a length, dug in, spins past Brathwaite's swing
smokes it over the long-off boundary! Fast and overpitched just outside off. Makes room and creams it from underneath. Mid-off was in, there was hardly any risk. Lovely batting
length outside off, pushed to point with an open face
short ball at middle stump, backs away and pulls to midwicket's right. Takes the run
147kph but it's a full toss. And Oshane offers the full face and gratefully plays this out
miscued pull but he has managed to drag it to deep square's right. Too early through this shot as he tries to drag the short ball from wide outside off
clears long-on! Flat-bats it and hardly gets height on this, but he's got plenty of distance. Literally swipes from above waist height
and another! It is no longer a clear New Zealand advantage! Low full toss wide outside off. Reaches out and gets bat - just enough bat - to get it to land on the padding at deep backward point!

it is too full! It is too far outside off! Knee high full toss with lots of width and he smokes it over wide long-off! Unreal. How does he keep finding himself in these situations, and doing this? Three in a row.

top edge clears the wicketkeeper! Hear in the mouth, but he fortune is all his, it seems! Bouncer cramps him at the chest. He has no control over this shot. But it's trickled through to the third man boundary. 24 off the over!
lofted to third man's right and he will keep strike! Short outside off and he holds his composure
short of a length outside off, watchfully tapped to extra cover
beaten! Whew. Short and wide outside off. Backs away and has a swipe but it some distance away from connection
beaten again. Short and wide outside off. Once again he's gone for the pull. Misses again

pulls out to deep midwicket and comes back for the second! What. An. Innings. He doesn't get to do a lot very often, down at No. 8. But every time he finds himself in this situation, he shines through. A maiden ODI hundred. An unlikely win in sight. Takes his helmet off, blows a kiss. Back to it.
legcutter, short and spinning past off stump as he shapes to pull and is deceived again. Beaten. This is a great over from Neesham

has he done it? No! Boult plucks it at long-on! Two drops for Boult since the last game, but he's held on when it's mattered! They're checking for no-ball...it's well behind the line. This is heartbreak for Brathwaite. So close. Short ball at middle, he pulled it, but slightly from under again. Ended up slicing it, with no room. It was to Boult's right. He leaped, he held on, he balanced on his right foot. That is solid work under pressure. Both batsmen on their knees, and then Brathwaite gets up with a smile. He did his all, and then some. But it was always unlikely. And you feel like he knows that. Smiles from his opponents as they offer their commiserations. It's all shakes. It could have so easily been the other way round...
